alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 3:56AM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Millington affecting Somerset and Morris Counties. For the Passaic River...including Millington, Chatham, Pine Brook, Singac, Little Falls...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occuring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Millington. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Backyards floods along Madison Street in Long Hill Township due to backwater. At 7.5 feet, Flooding along Morristown Road in the Gillette section on Long Hill Township. Flooding along Warren Avenue in the Stirling Section of Long Hill Township. Both due to backwater. At 8.0 feet, Bungalow Terrace in Millington begins to flood. Lord Sterling Road in Millington begins to flood. Parking lots along Valley Road in Long Hill Township begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 7.6 feet and then begin rising just after midnight tonight. It will then rise above flood stage early this morning to 8.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 02/26/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Passaic River Millington 8.0 8.0 Fri 3 am 7.6 8.1 8.2 7pm 1/13 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1000 AM EST.
